org.eclipse.keyple.example.common.calypso.transaction

Class HoplinkTransactionEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.example.common.generic.AbstractTransactionEngine
      • org.eclipse.keyple.example.common.calypso.transaction.HoplinkTransactionEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.event.ObservableReader.ReaderObserver, org.eclipse.keyple.util.Observable.Observer<org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.event.ReaderEvent>

    public class HoplinkTransactionEngine
extends AbstractTransactionEngine
implements org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.event.ObservableReader.ReaderObserver
    This Calypso demonstration code consists in:
    1. Setting up a two-reader configuration and adding an observer method (update)
    2. Starting a card operation when a PO presence is notified (operateSeTransaction)
    3. Opening a logical channel with the SAM (C1 SAM is expected) see (SAM_C1_ATR_REGEX)
    4. Attempting to open a logical channel with the PO with 3 options:
      • Selection with a fake AID
      • Selection with a Navigo AID
      • Selection with a Hoplink AID
    5. If the Hoplink selection succeeded, do an Hoplink transaction ({doHoplinkReadWriteTransaction(PoTransaction, ApduResponse, boolean)} doHoplinkReadWriteTransaction}).

    The Hoplink transactions demonstrated here shows the Keyple API in use with Hoplink SE (PO and SAM).

    Read the doc of each methods for further details.

      • setReaders

      • doHoplinkReadWriteTransaction

        public void doHoplinkReadWriteTransaction(org.eclipse.keyple.calypso.transaction.PoTransaction poTransaction,
                                          boolean closeSeChannel)
                                   throws org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException
        Do a Hoplink transaction:
        • Process opening
        • Process PO commands
        • Process closing

        File with SFI 1A is read on session opening.

        T2 Environment and T2 Usage are read in session.

        The PO logical channel is kept open or closed according to the closeSeChannel flag

        Parameters:
        poTransaction - PoTransaction object
        closeSeChannel - flag to ask or not the channel closing at the end of the transaction
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.exception.KeypleReaderException - reader exception (defined as public for purposes of javadoc)

      • operateSeTransaction

        public void operateSeTransaction()
        Do the PO selection and possibly go on with Hoplink transactions.
        Specified by:
        operateSeTransaction in class AbstractTransactionEngine
